result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Competency hearings.  Court relates on the report received and that Defendant is competent.  Atotrney Knaak relates defendant agrees she is competent. Order of Commitment-Treatment CR-206

3:28 p.m. Defendant Danielle R Hagen in court.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Danielle R Hagen. Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr. Minter appears by Zoom video.  
COVERS 21CM211, 21CT97, 21CT122 & 22CF121.
Competency Report filed 06/23/2022. Attorney Knaak relates Defendant asserts she is competent.  Court questions Defendant and she believes she is competent. 3:32 p.m. Dr. Minter called and sworn.  Direct by State.  3:49 p.m. Questioned by Attorney Knaak. 3:50 p.m. Questioned by Court. L.E. mother of Defendant called and sworn.  Direct by Attorney Knaak. 3:53 p.m. Cross by State. 3:55 p.m. Questioned by Court.  4:03 p.m. Court takes a short recess for Attorney Knaak to meet with Defendant in the hallway.  4:09 a.m. back on the record.  Attorney Knaak relates after discussion with Defendant now agrees she is NOT competent to proceed.  Court relates based on all the testimony today and discussion with Defendant that the Court finds Defendant is NOT competent at this time, nor can she fully assist in her defense. 
 Court finds her incompetent and suspends further proceedings not to exceed 1 year.  Status hearing set in all files before Judge Bitney.  State to prepare the Orders and that it applies to all files that are pending.  State relates on 2 days credit.  Bond continues.
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

8:30 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Danielle R Hagen. Defendant Danielle R Hagen not in court. 
This covers 22CF121, 21CM211, 21CT97, 21CT122
Report was filed yesterday. Attorney Knaak has not had an opportunity to review the Report with the defendant.
Competency Hearing adjourned.
Court phones Dr. Menter to inquire whether Dr. Menter is available on June 28th and Dr. Menter confirms.
Competency hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Danielle R Hagen appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video for Danielle R Hagen.
Qualifies for Public Defender. Attorney Wright relates competency has been raised in 2 open cases and competency hearings are scheduled. Attorney Knaak relates and requests competency hearing. Court finds reason to believe competency is an issue and orders this case be added to the Order for Competency. 1:06 Attorney Knaak and Defendant put in a break out room. 1:07 Attorney Knaak relates. Court orders bond. Defendant must appear in person for next hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
